entry.title: Interesting Thingys 69
entry.content:
Don't miss Vyacheslav Egorov's talk @ lxjs, very entertaining.

JavaScript

  • Preventing 'layout thrashing' | Wilson Page Layout Thrashing is when JavaScript violently writes, then reads, from the DOM, multiple times causing document reflows.
  • Functional Refactoring in JavaScript | Victor Savkin on Software Architecture a nice walkthrough of refactoring a function step by step
  • ▶ Vyacheslav Egorov - LXJS 2013 - Performance and benchmarking - YouTube how VMs outsmart performance tests
  • Dropzone.js DropzoneJS is an open source library that provides drag'n'drop file uploads with image previews.
  • ILOVEPIE/Shader.js A small and compact closure-compiler compatible javascript library for managing shaders.

CSS

  • Interview Questions and Exercises About CSS | CSS-Tricks If you're in the position of needing to interview someone about their skill and knowledge about CSS, it can be a little hard to think of things to ask on-the-fly.

Web Development

  • How to prioritize visible content for pagespeed enhance percieved performance
  • This Is Responsive | Tips, Resources and Patterns for Responsive Web Design a very helpful page!
  • Einführung in die Entwicklung von Smart-TV-Apps » t3n A german read about how to get into developing SmartTV Apps.
  • Odometer — Transition numbers with ease Beautiful CSS3 Number Transitions
  • Fyrdility » Blog Archive » Preview the new caniuse.com features the beta has some nice features
  • Creating a Dynamic Hero Image Using Canvas - Spark: Lamplighter Blog nice idea

Node.js

  • From Java to Node.js | n0tw0rthy rather long
  • What is Node.js? - Stack Overflow A really long answer
  • [r.va.gg] All the levels! the level ecosystem is growing each day
  • karlwestin/node-gumbo-parser Parsing HTML in node using google's gumbo parser

Clojure

  • tazjin/clojure-basics A collection of interesting things for people who want to start learning Clojure.

Programming

  • vhf/free-programming-books This list initially was a clone of stackoverflow - List of freely available programming books by George Stocker.

Databases

  • Geolocation with PostgreSQL a walkthrough of what Postgres can do for you
  • I learn as I go along: Efficient Techniques for Fuzzy and Partial matching in mongoDB a number of techniques, in MongoDB, for efficiently finding documents that have a number of similar attributes to a supplied query whilst not being an exact match

Editors

  • SublimeGit Full-featured Git integration for Sublime Text 2 and 3.

Tools

  • opserver/Opserver Stack Exchange's Monitoring System

Watching

  • JSConf EU 2013 - YouTube 12 videos from jsconf eu
  • The Functional Database Rich Hickey discusses how a functional database can impact the programming model, using Datomic as an example, but the principles apply to other systems using an immutable database.

Miscellaneous

  • google/gumbo-parser A pure-C HTML5 parser.
  • Introducing government.github.com Governments at all levels have been using GitHub for some time now to build better, more accessible websites, publish laws and data, and even collaborate on policies themselves.

Fun

  • Twitter / patrickdijusto: Cop pulls over Werner Heisenberg, ... no comment
  • IGN presents Museum of Mario An interactive experience exploring the many eras of Mario. Turn on the audio and click around to find hidden interactions!

Your link could be here

If we missed something special or you just want to promote a site, give us a nudge @ yieldthedog@gmail.com

entry.title: Interesting Thingys 68
entry.content:
A frontend centric Interesting Thingys edition.

JavaScript

  • The JavaScript console API cross browser consoles explained
  • mgechev/angularjs-style-guide Community-driven set of best practices for AngularJS application development
  • [JSConfUS 2013] Domenic Denicola: Boom, Promises/A Was Born - YouTube what they are and how they came about

CSS

  • CSS Device Adaptation with @viewport When we need to adjust a device’s browser viewport, the HTML tag is usually our go-to solution. But the viewport meta tag is surprisingly “non-normative”––it’s not a formal W3C spec, much less a web standard.
  • Flexbox First The Flexbox spec is finally stable, but browser support isn't there yet.
  • Flexbox layout isn't slow - HTML5Rocks Updates messures the performance of the old model versus the new model

HTML5

  • Building Web Apps With Yeoman And Polymer - HTML5 Rocks Scaffold your webapps with modern tooling

Web Development

  • Using SVG gradients and filters with d3.js | 4waisenkinder How to leverage the powers of gradients and filters to visualize stats
  • collectiveip/prerender Node server that uses phantomjs to render a javascript-rendered page as HTML. To be used in conjunction with prerender middleware.

Ruby

  • Capistrano Version 3 — Medium what's new in the big 3.0 release...

Node.js

  • Dave Pacheco's Blog » Node.js in production: runtime log snooping debug messages in production?
  • StrongLoop | How-to: Heap Snapshots and Handling Node.js Memory Leaks Taking dumps and analyzing them
  • Continuous Development in Node.js - Pony Foo automate all the things
  • hij1nx/level-channels A simpler way to selectively stream future or historic changes.

Java

  • If Java Is Dying, It Sure Looks Awfully Healthy | Dr Dobb's The odd, but popular, assertion that Java is dying can be made only in spite of the evidence, not because of it.

Reading

  • I-Tier - Groupon Engineering Blog Groupon moved their whole App from RoR to Node.js

Miscellaneous

  • Runnable Full-stack code anyone can run from their browser

Your link could be here

If we missed something special or you just want to promote a site, give us a nudge @ yieldthedog@gmail.com

entry.title: Interesting Thingys 67
entry.content:
And another round of thingys

JavaScript

  • How I fixed an anonymous infinite loop in jsbin Remy Sharp guides through his adventures
  • JSDB.io - The Database of JavaScript Libraries The definitive source of the best JavaScript frameworks, plugins, and tools
  • angular-gettext Super-simple translation support for Angular.JS
  • juliangruber/validimir Create validation functions
  • spy-js/spy-js spy-js: javascript tracing tool http://spy-js.com

CSS

  • Solved By Flexbox I wish I could use it in my daily work

HTML5

  • Stunning Procedural Skies In WebGL – Part 1 nice WebGL demo

Web Development

  • favico.js - Make a use of your favicon Make a use of your favicon
  • teppeis/grunt-parallelize This plugin divides src files of your task and executes them in parallel.
  • More maintainable Gruntfiles A simple way to organize your tasks
  • Lo-Dash 2.0 modularized and custom builds (with grunt plugin)
  • Web performance 2.0 A thorough roundup on how responsive design implementations effect performance
  • Google Web Designer Create engaging, interactive HTML5-based designs and motion graphics that can run on any device.
  • gemal.dk - HTML5 Flash Player (Shumway ) landed in Firefox. Plays swfs without flash
  • requestAutocomplete - take my money, not my time - HTML5 Rocks a deep dive into autocompletion the HTML5 way
  • Performance Matters An A List Apart's take on web performance
  • Advanced Jank Busting in Chrome – Nat Duca A must see

Node.js

  • rvagg/through2 Tiny wrapper around Node streams2 Transform to avoid explicit subclassing noise
  • thlorenz/inspect-stream Inspects a nodejs stream 2 and logs the data that's coming through.
  • dominictarr/cyphernet secure replicatable tree database.

Programming

  • Dance you Imps! | 8th Light Uncle Bob on ORMs

Tools

  • Excel and CSV Conversion to JSON and XML in JavaScript nice online converter

Performance

  • An Insider's View of Mobile-First Design: Don't Make These Mistakes | Wired Opinion | Wired.com It’s no secret that mobile networks can be much slower than those connected to PCs, and nothing frustrates mobile users more than a long load time. As Instagram co-founder Mike Krieger put it, “Who wants to wait while they’re waiting?”

Miscellaneous

  • algorithm - How to pair socks from a pile efficiently? - Stack Overflow Optimize your life
  • github - 3D File Diffs you can now see diffs of 3d objects
  • google/lmctfy lmctfy is the open source version of Google’s container stack, which provides Linux application containers.

Your link could be here

If we missed something special or you just want to promote a site, give us a nudge @ yieldthedog@gmail.com

entry.title: Interesting Thingys 66
entry.content:
And another release of exciting Thingys

JavaScript

  • Home | ngBoilerplate Everything you need to kickstart AngularJS projects: a best-practice directory structure, an intelligent build system, and the best web design libraries around.
  • Ember.js - Ember 1.0 Released the big 1.0 for Ember is out
  • Ember Inspector Ember.js Inspector is now available on the Chrome Web Store
  • adobe-research/theseus A pretty darn cool JavaScript debugger for Brackets

CSS

  • 3D Shading with Box-Shadows | Codrops A tutorial about a technique that uses box shadows for creating a realistic shading effect on simple objects.
  • Transitions for Off-Canvas Navigations | Codrops Some inspiration for transition effects for off-canvas navigations.

Web Development

  • andismith/grunt-responsive-images · GitHub Produce Responsive Images
  • CSS Sprites vs. Data URIs Eine weitere Untersuchung zeigt, dass man bei der Frontend-Entwicklung für Mobile Devices auf Data-URL verzichten sollte.
  • Custom Elements: defining new elements in HTML - HTML5 Rocks webcomponents overview

Mobile Webdevelopment

  • Brick UI Components for Modern Web Apps

Ruby

  • Method definitions in Ruby 2.1.0 will not be void anymore - Franck Verrot they return the method symbol

Node.js

  • Developing mobile apps with Node.js and MongoDB, Part 1: A team's methods and results Speeding time to value of systems of engagement
  • Developing mobile apps with Node.js and MongoDB, Part 2: Hints and tips Avoiding the pitfalls of using an alternative stack
  • tpeden/express-resource-new Clean, rails-like, resourceful routing for Express

Scala

  • twitter/summingbird Streaming MapReduce with Scalding and Storm https://twitter.com/summingbird

Clojure

  • Factual/skuld Distributed task tracking system.

Databases

  • The MongoDB Blog Faceted search, or faceted navigation, is a way of browsing and searching for items in a set of data by applying filters on various properties (facets) of the items in the collection.

Git

  • FredrikNoren/ungit The easiest way to use git. On any platform. Anywhere.

Watching

  • ▶ [CSSConfUS 2013] Lea Verou: The Humble Border-radius - YouTube Another great presentation by Lea Verou

Miscellaneous

  • The Observation Deck » Happy 10th Birthday, DTrace! Ten years ago this morning — at 10:27a local time, to be exact — DTrace was integrated.

Deployment

  • Docker: Git for deployment Finally, an efficient way to simulate our production environment

Your link could be here

If we missed something special or you just want to promote a site, give us a nudge @ yieldthedog@gmail.com

entry.title: Interesting Thingys 65
entry.content:
After a recreational pause we are back with lots of thingys that gathered over the summer.

JavaScript

  • justindeguzman/locstor JavaScript helper library for HTML5 localStorage
  • Tessel Tessel is an Internet-connected microcontroller for software developers.

CSS

  • Absolute Centering - CodePen an alternative approach
  • codrops/CreativeLinkEffects An inspirational collection of experimental link effects mostly using transitions on pseudo-elements.
  • HugoGiraudel/Sass-snippets A couple of Sass tricks

HTML5

  • Alpha transparency in Chrome video - HTML5Rocks Updates nice work

Web Development

  • Speed Up Your Web Development Workflow with Grunt In a series of tutorials, I’m going to help you get started with Grunt, an open source JavaScript task runner that will automate some of your web development tasks.
  • Front-end performance for web designers and front-end developers – CSS Wizardry – CSS, OOCSS, front-end architecture, performance and more, by Harry Roberts It’s hard, if not impossible, to deny that performance is by far one of the most critical aspects of any decent web project, be it a small portfolio site, a mobile-first web app, right through to a full-scale ecommerce project.
  • component/infinity infinite scrolling with loading and unloading.
  • kenkeiter/skeuocard Skeuocard progressively enhances credit card inputs to provide a skeuomorphic interface.
  • Angular Hovercard Demo a small directive for a nice hover effect
  • A Guide To Designing Touch Keyboards (With Cheat Sheet) | Smashing UX Design Users interact directly with touch interfaces, which narrows the gap between human act and software response.
  • Bower 1.0.0 completely rewritten
  • “Grunt” your way to frontend performance optimization | Be better and faster a nice compilation
  • Multi-Level Push Menu | Codrops An experimental push menu with multi-level functionality that allows endless nesting of navigation elements.
  • lucb1e/cookielesscookies Demo of tracking using etags instead of cookies (or localstorage or anything else)
  • operasoftware/ucss Find unused and duplicate CSS
  • tsenart/vegeta HTTP load testing tool and library
  • Web Performance Crash Course - Fluent 2013 - YouTube From the ground up introduction to the field of web performance optimization: network bottlenecks, the document parsing and evaluation pipeline, visual layout, javascript, and more. We'll investigate each in order and then pull it all together through case studies and hands-on examples.
  • VictorBjelkholm/ngProgress Angular provider for slim loading bar at the top of the page ( inspired by https://github.com/rstacruz/nprogress )
  • Niklas von Hertzen - Click heatmaps with Google Analytics with demo

Python

  • CamDavidsonPilon/Probabilistic-Programming-and-Bayesian-Methods-for-Hackers aka "Bayesian Methods for Hackers": An introduction to Bayesian methods probabilistic programming with a computation/understanding-first, mathematics-second point of view. All in pure Python

Node.js

  • Bone.io - Realtime HTML5 Framework Bone.io is a lightweight framework for building high performance Realtime Single Page HTML5 Apps
  • substack/webworkify launch a web worker that can require() in the browser with browserify
  • substack/level-assoc relational foreign key associations (hasMany, belongsTo) for leveldb

Scala

  • davidpeklak/smt simple database migrations tool. Example @ https://github.com/davidpeklak/smt-usage

Clojure

  • ztellman/byte-transforms methods for hashing, compressing, and encoding bytes
  • lynaghk/jetty7-websockets-async Clojure core.async interface to Jetty7's websockets.

Programming

  • samsquire/ideas a record of ideas
  • The future of programming - O'Reilly Radar Unraveling what programming will need for the next 10 years.

Editors

  • Sublime Packages A searchable index of Sublime Text packages hosted on Github
  • Vim 7.4 released With thouthands of patches

Security

  • Introducing Minion | Mozilla Security Blog Minion is a platform developed by the Security Automation team at Mozilla to enable integration and adoption of automated security testing that has been under development for the past year.

Watching

  • Bret Victor - The Future of Programming on Vimeo presented at dropbox conf

Reading

  • Sneak Peek: HuffPost Brings Real Time Collaboration to the Newsroom | John Pavley nice "behind the scenes" of the new upcoming huffington post editor tools

Miscellaneous

  • SSH Escape Sequences (aka Kill Dead SSH Sessions) — The Lone Sysadmin what can you do with dead ssh sessions?

Fun

  • Regex Crossword A crossword with regexes

Raspberry Pi

  • Wearables: Raspberry Pi Glass Domestic Hacks has made a 3d-printed, steampunk inspired, fabulous, wearable Pi.

Your link could be here

If we missed something special or you just want to promote a site, give us a nudge @ yieldthedog@gmail.com
